# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily discusses Fly.io storage usage and billing concerns. Users received emails about storage usage, with one user noting their world uses 5GB of storage. HypPrivakos explained that snapshots count toward storage limits (each 5GB snapshot adds to the total), but mentioned Fly.io doesn't charge for amounts below $1 due to transaction fees. There was discussion about the CLEAN=true environment variable that helps remove deleted entities from disk to reduce storage usage. A user confirmed this feature is enabled by default on newer worlds. The conversation also touched on how deployments create snapshots that contribute to storage usage.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Does the world auto-clean now? (asked by ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“) A: By default it cleans now, but only on newer worlds, you can check your .env for `CLEAN=true` (answered by ash)
Q: Wen 402x integration? (If not blockchain Integration for REAL people?) (asked by Agent12) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: HypPrivakos - HyperWorld.Host | Helpee: ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“ | Context: User concerned about 5GB storage usage on Fly.io | Resolution: Explained snapshots count toward storage limits and suggested checking CLEAN=true environment variable to remove deleted entities
Helper: ash | Helpee: ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“ | Context: Question about auto-cleaning functionality | Resolution: Clarified that auto-cleaning is enabled by default on newer worlds and suggested checking for CLEAN=true in .env file

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Check and enable CLEAN=true environment variable to reduce storage usage | Description: Add "CLEAN=true" to environment variables to remove deleted entities from disk | Mentioned By: HypPrivakos - HyperWorld.Host

The chat segment is extremely brief, containing only two messages. CheddarQueso ğŸ§€ expressed appreciation for the Hyperfy litepaper, and ailes responded with a Hyperfy emoji. There are no technical discussions, problem-solving activities, or concrete implementations to summarize in this limited exchange.

The chat segment is very brief with minimal technical discussion. Valiant shared a link to a Gaussian VRM project (https://gaussian-vrm.github.io/) along with a related X post that requires translation. TheMattEmpire inquired about streaming capabilities on custom 3D objects, specifically asking if mesh updates are possible. Another user, untitled, xyz, requested help with node configuration for creating a fading transparent/glowing cone effect. The conversation ends with ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“ asking "does this work?" without providing additional context or solution.
